nodes.name: Human Knowledge
nodes.desc: The totality of human understanding.

nodes.name: Mathematics
nodes.desc: Science of structure, order, and relation.

nodes.name: Physics
nodes.desc: Study of matter and its motion.

nodes.name: Astronomy
nodes.desc: Study of celestial objects.

nodes.name: Computing
nodes.desc: The study of algorithmic processes.

nodes.name: Software
nodes.desc: Programs and other operating information.

nodes.name: Hardware
nodes.desc: The physical components of a computer.

nodes.name: Linux
nodes.desc: Open-source kernel and operating system.

nodes.name: Philosophy
nodes.desc: Study of fundamental nature of existence.

nodes.name: Logic
nodes.desc: Reasoning conducted according to strict principles.

nodes.name: Ethics
nodes.desc: Moral principles that govern behavior.

nodes.name: Epistemology
nodes.desc: The theory of knowledge.

nodes.name: Biology
nodes.desc: Study of living organisms.

nodes.name: Genetics
nodes.desc: Study of heredity and variation.

nodes.name: Evolution
nodes.desc: Process of development of organisms.

nodes.name: Algorithms
nodes.desc: Step-by-step procedures.

nodes.name: Space Exploration
nodes.desc: Discovery of celestial structures.

nodes.name: NASA
nodes.desc: Space research agency.

nodes.name: Artificial Intelligence
nodes.desc: Simulation of human intelligence by machines.

nodes.name: Machine Learning
nodes.desc: Study of computer algorithms that improve automatically.

nodes.name: History
nodes.desc: Study of past events.

nodes.name: World War II
nodes.desc: Global war that lasted from 1939 to 1945.

nodes.name: Ancient Rome
nodes.desc: Italic civilization that began on the Italian Peninsula.

nodes.name: Archaeology
nodes.desc: Study of human activity through the recovery of material culture.

nodes.name: Art
nodes.desc: Diverse range of human activities in creating visual or performing artifacts.

nodes.name: Painting
nodes.desc: Practice of applying paint, pigment, color or other medium.

nodes.name: Renaissance
nodes.desc: Period in European history marking the transition from the Middle Ages.

nodes.name: Literature
nodes.desc: Written works, especially those considered of superior or lasting merit.

nodes.name: Shakespeare
nodes.desc: English playwright, poet, and actor.

nodes.name: Geography
nodes.desc: Field of science devoted to the study of the lands, features, inhabitants.

nodes.name: Mount Everest
nodes.desc: Earth's highest mountain above sea level.

nodes.name: Ocean
nodes.desc: Body of saline water that composes much of a planet's hydrosphere.
